SEARCH
Package cesur.accesodatos.db4o

Class db4oDAO

java.lang.Object
cesur.accesodatos.db4o.db4oDAO
All Implemented Interfaces:
FileHandlerInterface, IDAO, Menu
public class db4oDAO extends Object implements IDAO, Menu, FileHandlerInterface
db4o-based Data Access Object (DAO) component for managing data persistence. This class utilizes db4o, an object database, to perform CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations on entities such as Employees and Departments. Designed to be efficient and user-friendly, it abstracts the complexities of direct database manipulation, providing straightforward methods for data management. Ensure the db4o database path is correctly configured before initiating operations. IDAO for data operations. FileHandlerInterface for file database management. Menu for user related interactions.

  • Method Details

    • checkDBExists

      public boolean checkDBExists()
      Checks if the db4o database file exists at the specified path. This method attempts to verify the presence of a db4o database file by checking the filesystem. It sets the connectionFlag based on the file's existence to indicate the availability of the database for further operations.
      Specified by:
      checkDBExists in interface FileHandlerInterface
      Returns:
      true if the database file exists, false otherwise. It also returns false if an error occurs during the check.

    • closeConnection

      public void closeConnection()
      Closes the db4o database connection if it's currently open. This method attempts to close the db4o database connection gracefully, ensuring all resources are freed properly. If the connection is successfully closed, a confirmation message is printed to the console. If an error occurs during the closure process, an error message is displayed, detailing the issue encountered.
      Specified by:
      closeConnection in interface FileHandlerInterface

    • findAllEmployees

      public List<Employee> findAllEmployees()
      Retrieves all Employee objects from the db4o database. This method queries the db4o database for all instances of the Employee class, adding each to a list of Employee objects. If an error occurs during the retrieval process, an error message is printed with the exception's details.
      Specified by:
      findAllEmployees in interface IDAO
      Returns:
      A list of all Employee objects found in the database. Returns an empty list if no employees are found or if an error occurs.

    • findEmployeeById

      public Employee findEmployeeById(Object id)
      Searches for an Employee in the db4o database by their ID. This method accepts an Object as an ID, which it expects to be an Integer. It validates the ID's data type before proceeding with the search. It utilizes a db4o query with a Predicate to find the employee whose employee number matches the given ID. If found, it returns the first matching Employee object, assuming ID uniqueness. Otherwise, it notifies the user of the absence of such an employee.
      Specified by:
      findEmployeeById in interface IDAO
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier for the employee, expected to be an Integer.
      Returns:
      The Employee object matching the given ID, or null if no matching employee is found or an invalid ID is provided.

    • addEmployee

      public void addEmployee(Employee employee)
      Adds a given Employee object to the db4o database. This method stores the provided Employee object in the db4o database and commits the transaction to ensure the data is saved. If an error occurs during the process, the transaction is rolled back, and an error message is printed. It checks if the database connection is established before attempting to add the employee.
      Specified by:
      addEmployee in interface IDAO
      Parameters:
      employee - The Employee object to be added to the database. It should have all its attributes set.

    • updateEmployee

      public Employee updateEmployee(Object id)
      Updates the information of an existing employee identified by the provided ID. Validates the ID to ensure it's an integer and searches for the corresponding employee in the database. If the employee is found, prompts for new values for the employee's last name, job, and department ID. Updates the employee's information in the db4o database and commits the changes. If any provided values are empty or if the department ID is invalid, an error message is displayed and the update is not performed. If an error occurs during the database operation, the transaction is rolled back.
      Specified by:
      updateEmployee in interface IDAO
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the employee to update, must be an Integer.
      Returns:
      The updated Employee object, or null if the ID is invalid, the employee is not found, or an error occurs.

    • deleteEmployee

      public Employee deleteEmployee(Object id)
      Deletes an employee from the db4o database based on the provided ID. Validates the provided ID to ensure it's an integer and checks if the database connection is established. Queries the database for the employee matching the given ID. If found, the employee is deleted from the database, and a confirmation message is printed. If no matching employee is found, a message indicating this is printed.
      Specified by:
      deleteEmployee in interface IDAO
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the employee to be deleted, must be an Integer.
      Returns:
      The Employee object that was deleted, or null if the ID is invalid, the employee is not found, or the database connection is not established.

    • findAllDepartments

      public List<Department> findAllDepartments()
      Retrieves all Department objects from the db4o database. This method queries the db4o database for all instances of the Department class, adding each to a list of Department objects. It prints the total number of departments found to the console. If an error occurs during the retrieval process, an error message is printed with the exception's details. Checks if the database connection is established before attempting to retrieve departments.
      Specified by:
      findAllDepartments in interface IDAO
      Returns:
      A list of all Department objects found in the database. If the database connection is not established or an error occurs, the list may be empty.

    • findDepartmentById

      public Department findDepartmentById(Object id)
      Retrieves a Department object from the db4o database by its ID. Validates the ID to ensure it's an integer before attempting a search. Utilizes db4o's queryByExample method to find the Department matching the given ID. If a matching department is found, it's returned; otherwise, a message indicating no such department is printed. Checks if the database connection is established before attempting the search.
      Specified by:
      findDepartmentById in interface IDAO
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the department to find, expected to be an Integer.
      Returns:
      The found Department object if present, or null if not found or in case of an invalid ID.

    • addDepartment

      public void addDepartment(Department department)
      Adds a specified Department object to the db4o database. This method attempts to store the provided Department object in the db4o database, ensuring data persistence by committing the transaction. If an exception occurs during the process, the transaction is rolled back to maintain database integrity, and an error message is printed. Before attempting to add the department, it verifies that the database connection is properly established.
      Specified by:
      addDepartment in interface IDAO
      Parameters:
      department - The Department object to be added to the database, with all necessary attributes set.

    • updateDepartment

      public Department updateDepartment(Object id)
      Updates the information of an existing department identified by the provided ID. Validates the ID to ensure it's an integer and searches for the corresponding department in the database. If the department is found, prompts for new values for the department's name and city. Updates the department's information in the db4o database and commits the changes. If any provided values are empty, an error message is displayed and the update is not performed. If an error occurs during the database operation, the transaction is rolled back.
      Specified by:
      updateDepartment in interface IDAO
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the department to update, must be an Integer.
      Returns:
      The updated Department object, or null if the ID is invalid, the department is not found, or an error occurs.

    • deleteDepartment

      public Department deleteDepartment(Object id)
      Deletes a department identified by the provided ID from the db4o database. Validates the ID to ensure it's an integer and searches for the department to delete. If the department is found, it is removed from the database, and the transaction is committed to confirm the deletion. An error message is printed, and the transaction is rolled back if an error occurs during the deletion process.
      Specified by:
      deleteDepartment in interface IDAO
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the department to delete, must be an Integer.
      Returns:
      The Department object that was deleted, or null if the ID is invalid, the department is not found, or an error occurs.

    • findEmployeesByDept

      public List<Employee> findEmployeesByDept(Object idDept)
      Retrieves a list of employees who belong to a specified department. Validates the department ID to ensure it's an integer before querying the db4o database for employees in that department. Iterates over all employees, adding those whose department number matches the provided ID to the list.
      Specified by:
      findEmployeesByDept in interface IDAO
      Parameters:
      idDept - The unique identifier of the department whose employees are to be found. Expected to be of type Integer.
      Returns:
      A list of Employee objects associated with the specified department ID. Returns an empty list if the department ID is invalid or if no employees are found in the specified department. Returns null if an error occurs during retrieval.

      public void executeFindAllEmployees()
      Description copied from interface: Menu
      Method to display a table with all Employees stored. This method displays all Employees information in a table view from a list that is returned by IDAO's corresponding method, that will be called inside. If the returned list is empty, a message notifying it will be shown.

      executeFindAllEmployees in interface Menu

    • executeFindEmployeeByID

      public void executeFindEmployeeByID()
      Description copied from interface: Menu
      Method to display an Employee found by its ID. This method asks the user for a numeric ID and execute the corresponding IDAO's method. If an Employee is found, the toString() method is displayed, if not an error will be shown.
      Specified by:
      executeFindEmployeeByID in interface Menu

    • executeAddEmployee

      public void executeAddEmployee()
      Description copied from interface: Menu
      Method to add new Employee. This method asks the user for all required information to create a new Employee. If any input from user is not good, an error will be displayed and the method execution stops. If all inputs from user are good (all data is valid), the corresponding IDAO's method will be executed.
      Specified by:
      executeAddEmployee in interface Menu

    • executeUpdateEmployee

      public void executeUpdateEmployee()
      Description copied from interface: Menu
      Method to update an existing Employee. This method asks the user for a numeric ID, checks if there is an existing Employee with that ID and if so, executes the corresponding IDAO's method. If there is no Employee with the ID, an error will be shown.
      Specified by:
      executeUpdateEmployee in interface Menu
